results.title: The Craic
results.creator_credit: Crack Pty Ltd, Foster Gracie, Geffer Notice, Australian Film Commission, David Foster, Marc Gracie, Jimeoin McKeown and Ted Emery
results.brief_description: Craic is Irish slang for a laugh or a good time, which is what this comedy about two Irishmen on the run in Australia is all about. Fergus (Jimeoin) and his best friend Wesley (Alan McKee) are living in Belfast when they incur the wrath of violent IRA leader, Colin (Robert Morgan). Since Ireland no longer seems like a safe place to stay, they head for Sydney, where they manage to find work despite not having the necessary work permits. Fergus gets a chance to appear on TVs “The Dating Game” and wins a vacation to Queensland. However immigration authorities become aware of the friends’ illegal status and Wesley tracks down Fergus, just in time to meet up with Colin who has come to Australia as part of the witness protection program. Thus a mad chase ensues as Fergus and Wesley head for the outback with immigration agents, secret service men and IRA renegades hot on their trail.

results.title: The Craft
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, Douglas Wick and Andrew Fleming
results.brief_description: Uprooted from her familiar surroundings and forced to move to Los Angeles with her father and stepmother, Sarah (Robin Tunney) is disappointed to find that she is again relegated to the role of the outsider at St. Benedict’s Academy. However, the main thing that sets her apart from the others - her magical ability - soon draws the attention of fellow misfits Nancy (Fairuza Balk), Bonnie (Neve Campbell) and Rochelle (Rachel True), who try to recruit her as the fourth member of their coven. Sarah is at first unwilling to enter their world of magic and ritual, afraid of her own untapped powers and sceptical of the others’ euphoric worship of the deity, Manon, but when her reputation is ruined after an encounter with the school’s most popular boy, Chris (Skeet Ulrich), she reconsiders. The four bind themselves into a formal coven one afternoon and cast their first spell as a group: Rochelle asks for revenge on a racist class-mate, Sarah asks that Chris fall in love with her, Bonnie asks for the severe burn scars that cover her body to be removed, and Nancy asks for all the power of Manon. Empowered by Sarah, a natural witch, their spells have the desired results, and the group becomes more close-knit as they continue their occult explorations. Feeling guilty about what she has done to Chris, Sarah seeks advice from the proprietor of the local occult shop, Lirio, who advises the group to be careful, as whatever they send out will return to them times three. The others ignore this advice and group leader Nancy soon becomes corrupted by the powers she is given after a midnight invocation on a stormy beach, resulting in the death of Chris. When Sarah suggests that the others practice more caution, they turn on her, tormenting her ceaselessly after she leaves their circle. Caught in a struggle between reality and illusion, Sarah is forced to invoke a greater power to help defend her against Nancy’s maliciously twisted magic. The soundtrack for this film features original music by composer Graeme Revell.

results.title: The Court jester
results.creator_credit: Dena Enterprises, Norman Panama and Melvin Frank
results.brief_description: Danny Kaye is the quintessential singing, dancing, royal clown in this classic musical comedy set in 12th century England which parodies Robin Hood style swashbuckling adventure films. He plays a court jester who accidentally falls in with a band of outlaws who are plotting to kill the king. They try to use the unwitting fool to get close to the king, however they do not reckon on his ability as a jouster as well as a jester, which brings their plans undone in a hilarious manner. Cast also includes Basil Rathbone, Angela Lansbury, Glynis Johns and Cecil Parker.

results.title: The Country girl
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, William Perlberg and George Seaton
results.brief_description: Grace Kelly received an Oscar for her brilliant portrayal of the wife, and Bing Crosby gave one of the most outstanding performances of his career as an alcoholic, guilt-ridden has-been. When he is given an opportunity to star in a new musical show, his wife (Grace Kelly) and the show’s director (William Holden) attempt to bolster his ego and help him make a comeback. This superb drama, based on Clifford Odet’s play, was nominated for seven Academy Awards.

results.title: The Corporation
results.creator_credit: Big Picture Media Corporation, Mark Achbar, Bart Simpson and Jennifer Abbott
results.brief_description: Entertaining, illuminating and exhaustively researched Canadian documentary about the rise in power and stature of corporations, and the impact felt throughout the world. Many topics are examined over the course of this work including exploitation of developing countries, company fraud, environmental impact of business on the natural world, business ethics, corporate espionage, media power, censorship, globalisation, marketing manipulation, privatisation and protests. Featuring a wide array of interviews, witty graphics and a soothing voice-over, the filmmakers succeed in making the complexities of the issues at play here understood whilst enrapturing the audience. Winner of the Best Documentary World Cinema Audience Award at the 2004 Sundance Film Festival. Interviewees include: Naomi Klein, Michael Moore and Noam Chomsky.

results.title: The Cook the thief his wife & her lover
results.creator_credit: Allarts Cook, Erato FIlms, Films Incorporated, Kees Kasander and Peter Greenaway
results.brief_description: The setting is a restaurant, La Hollondais, where the chef prepares a lavish menu every night. Among the regular customers are Albert Spica (Michael Gambon) a loud-mouthed, violent gangster who dines with his entourage of seedy men, and his bored, beautiful wife, Georgina (Helen Mirren). At another table each night sits Michael, a quiet man who’s always reading. He and Georgina soon begin a series of secret rendezvous, where they make passionate love. Eventually Albert discovers his wife’s infidelity and takes violent revenge, triggering a more unusual retaliation from her. This film is a parable about love, revenge and most of all greed, it is both funny and horrifying. Sacha Vierny’s cinematography and Greenaway’s use of colour are superb. Also stars Tim Roth, Richard Bohringer and Alan Howard.

results.title: The Computer wore tennis shoes
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Productions, Bill Anderson and Robert Butler
results.brief_description: Featuring a very young Kurt Russell as Dexter, student leader at Medfield College who is transformed into a human being with a hard drive memory when the computer he is repairing is unexpectedly struck by a bolt of lightning. This act of nature presents all manner of problems for Dexter as his brain begins to discover certain information about the somewhat suspect activities of the College’s rich benefactor A.J. Arno (Cesar Romero) who donated the computer in the first place. The story bounces along from adventure to adventure, revealing secrets and plans, a kidnapping and a rescue. Cast includes Joe Flynn, William Schallert, Alan Hewitt.

results.title: The Company of wolves
results.creator_credit: Palace Pictures, Chris Brown, Stephen Woolley and Neil Jordan
results.brief_description: This innovative, intelligent and visually sumptuous horror film is not a traditional werewolf movie, it explores the psychosexual undercurrents of the classic “Little Red Riding Hood” fairytale. Set almost entirely within the dreams and fantasy of thirteen year old Rosaleen who is stirred by passion; it foretells the fate of all young girls who stray from the forest path. Director Jordan is a distinctive stylist who knows how to convey the complex emotions and simmering sensuality of Angela Carter’s story. Stars Angela Lansbury as Granny and Sarah Patterson as Rosaleen. Screenplay by Angela Carter and Neil Jordan, adapted from a story by Angela Carter.

results.title: The Company of strangers [DVD]
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, David Wilson and Cynthia Scott
results.brief_description: A bus breaks down in the wilderness. Eight elderly women, average age 71, are stranded at a deserted farmhouse. They have only their wits, their memories, and eventually some roasted frogs’ legs, to sustain them. Through the long days and nights this remarkable group of strangers share their life stories and exchange intimate thoughts; turning the crisis into a magical time of humour and spirit. Featuring non-professional actors and spontaneous dialogue, this memorable film dissolves the barrier between fiction and reality, weaving a heartwarming tale of friendship and courage. Cast: Cissy Meddings, Mary Meigs, Catherine Roche, Michelle Sweeney, Beth Webber, Alice Diabo, Constance Garneau, Winifred Holden. Script, Gloria Demers, Cynthia Scott, David Wilson and Sally Bochner. Cinematography, David de Volpi. Music, Marie Bernard. Editing, David Wilson.

results.title: The Commitments
results.creator_credit: Sovereign Pictures, Roger Randall-Cutler, Lynda Myles and Allan Parker
results.brief_description: Alan Parker’s tale of an Irish working class band’s odyssey is a strident belt-you-in-the-mouth delight. On a mission to bring soul to Dublin plus fame and fortune for himself, Jimmy Rabbitte transforms a motley bunch of misfits and raw talent into ‘the hardest working band in the world’, THE COMMITMENTS, billing them as the ‘saviours of Soul’. Based on the cult novel by Roddy Doyle and set to a scorching soul soundtrack. This film pulsates with raw energy, colourful dialogue, working class struggles and big time dreams - it’s a knockout.
